alert.note: Alert for Harper (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 14 at 3:17AM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Very windy, warm, and dry conditions expected Wednesday... .An upper level storm system will move into the Central Plains Wednesday bringing strong southwest winds with it. Many locations may experience wind gusts over 45 mph by Wednesday afternoon, with stronger gusts perhaps exceeding 60 mph across across far northwestern Oklahoma. Well above average temperatures and minimum relative humidity in the mid teens will also be present, resulting in critical to extreme fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR HARPER COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels which is in effect from 9 AM to 6 PM CST Wednesday. * TIMING...Late morning through early evening. * WINDS...Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Upper 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start in this environment will become very difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will contribute to extreme fire behavior.
